panels.description:
Status of OpenSearch cluster.
If the cluster status is `degraded`, at least one replica shard is unallocated or missing. The search
   results will still be complete, but if more shards are missing, you may lose data.
   
   A `failed` cluster status indicates that:
   
    * At least one primary shard is missing.
    * You are missing data.
    * The searches will return partial results.
    * You will be blocked from indexing into that shard.

targets.query: SELECT max("status_code") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Cluster status

panels.description: Status of OpenSearch nodes

targets.query: SELECT min("number_of_nodes") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT last("total_number_of_nodes") - min("number_of_nodes") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Nodes status

panels.description: Maximum current CPU usage (in percent) among all OpenSearch servers.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Maximum current Memory usage (in percent) among all OpenSearch servers.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Transitions of OpenSearch cluster status
panels.title: Cluster Status Transitions

panels.description: Transitions of readiness probes for each OpenSearch pod.
panels.title: Pod Readiness Probe Transitions

panels.description: The number of active primary shards in OpenSearch cluster

targets.query: SELECT last("active_primary_shards") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Active primary shards

panels.description: The number of active primary and replica shards in OpenSearch cluster

targets.query: SELECT last("active_shards") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Active shards

panels.description: The number of shards that are in the `initializing` state. When you first create an index, or when a node is rebooted, its shards are briefly in the `initializing` state before transitioning to `started` or `unassigned` as the master node attempts to assign shards to nodes in the cluster. If you see the shards remain in the `initializing` state for too long, it could be a warning sign that your cluster is unstable.

targets.query: SELECT last("initializing_shards") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Initializing shards

panels.description: The number of shards that are relocating now and have the `relocating` state.

targets.query: SELECT last("relocating_shards") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Relocating shards

panels.description: The number of shards that are not assigned to any node and have the `unassigned` state. If you see the shards remain in the `unassigned` state for too long, it could be a warning sign that your cluster is unstable.

targets.query: SELECT max("unassigned_shards") FROM "opensearch_cluster_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Unassigned shards

panels.description: The number of tasks in 'pending' status in OpenSearch cluster
panels.title: Pending Tasks

panels.description: The maximum time in milliseconds that task is waiting in queue
panels.title: Time of Most Waiting Task

panels.description: The number of open transport connections for each OpenSearch node. May be not applicable for managed external OpenSearch.

targets.query: SELECT max("server_open") FROM "opensearch_transport" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Open transport connections

panels.description: The number of open HTTP connections for each OpenSearch node. If the total number of open HTTP connections is constantly increasing, it may indicate that your HTTP clients are not properly establishing persistent connections. Reestablishing connections adds extra milliseconds or even seconds to your request response time.

targets.query: SELECT max("current_open") as "open" FROM "opensearch_http" WHERE (node_name =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Open http connections

panels.description: The rate of change between subsequent size values of received (rx) and transmitted (tx) packages for each OpenSearch node. May be not applicable for managed external OpenSearch.

targets._comment: In the query 'count(rx_size_in_bytes) / count(rx_size_in_bytes)' part is added to have 'null' results, because by default 'non_negative_derivative' function returns nothing if interval does not contain values.
targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("rx_size_in_bytes"), 1s) * count("rx_size_in_bytes") / count("rx_size_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_transport" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

targets._comment: In the query 'count(tx_size_in_bytes) / count(tx_size_in_bytes)' part is added to have 'null' results, because by default 'non_negative_derivative' function returns nothing if interval does not contain values.
targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("tx_size_in_bytes"), 1s) * count("tx_size_in_bytes") / count("tx_size_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_transport" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND "cluster"="$cluster" AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Transport size

panels.description: The usage of JVM heap memory by each OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT mean("mem_heap_used_in_bytes") AS "used", mean("mem_heap_max_in_bytes") AS "total" FROM "opensearch_jvm" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: JVM heap usage

panels.description: OpenSearch is set up to initiate garbage collections whenever JVM heap usage hits 75 percent. As shown above, it may be useful to monitor which nodes exhibit high heap usage, and set up an alert to find out if any node is consistently using over 85 percent of heap memory; this indicates that the rate of garbage collection isn’t keeping up with the rate of garbage creation. To address this problem, you can either increase your heap size (as long as it remains below the recommended guidelines stated above), or scale out the cluster by adding more nodes.

targets.query: SELECT mean("mem_heap_used_percent") FROM "opensearch_jvm" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: JVM heap usage percent

panels.description: The usage of memory outside the JVM heap by each OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT mean("mem_non_heap_used_in_bytes") AS "used" FROM "opensearch_jvm" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: JVM non heap usage

panels.description: Time spent on major GCs that collect old generation objects and on minor GCs that collects young generation objects in JVM (time rate per sampling interval).

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_difference(max("gc_collectors_old_collection_time_in_millis")) * mean("gc_collectors_old_collection_time_in_millis") / mean("gc_collectors_old_collection_time_in_millis") AS "old", non_negative_difference(max("gc_collectors_young_collection_time_in_millis")) * mean("gc_collectors_young_collection_time_in_millis") / mean("gc_collectors_young_collection_time_in_millis") AS "young" FROM "opensearch_jvm" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: GC time

panels.description: The usage of memory by each OpenSearch node and its limit. These metric is useful to avoid reaching the memory limit on nodes.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory/usage" WHERE ("pod_name" =~ /^$node_name$*/ AND "type" = 'pod' AND "namespace_name" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod_name" fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory/limit" WHERE ("pod_name" =~ /^$node_name$*/ AND "type" = 'pod' AND "namespace_name" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod_name" fill(null)

panels.title: OS memory usage

panels.description: The usage of disk space in percent for an OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT 100 * (mean("total_total_in_bytes") - mean("total_free_in_bytes")) / mean("total_total_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" ,"node_host" fill(null)

panels.title: Disk usage in percent

panels.description: The usage of disk space allocated to each OpenSearch node and its limit

targets.query: SELECT mean("total_total_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name", "node_host" fill(null)

SELECT mean("total_total_in_bytes") - mean( "total_available_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  time($__interval), "node_name", "node_host" fill(null)

panels.title: Disk usage

panels.description: The rate of change between subsequent values of input/output operations per second for each OpenSearch node

targets._comment: In the query 'count(io_stats_total_read_operations) / count(io_stats_total_read_operations)' part is added to have 'null' results, because by default 'non_negative_derivative' function returns nothing if interval does not contain values.
targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("io_stats_total_read_operations"), 1s) * count("io_stats_total_read_operations") / count("io_stats_total_read_operations") AS "read", non_negative_derivative(mean("io_stats_total_write_operations"), 1s) AS "write" FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name", "node_host" fill(null)

panels.title: Disk I/O operations

panels.description: The rate of change between subsequent values of disk usage for each OpenSearch node

targets._comment: In the query 'count(io_stats_total_read_kilobytes) / count(io_stats_total_read_kilobytes)' part is added to have 'null' results, because by default 'non_negative_derivative' function returns nothing if interval does not contain values.
targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("io_stats_total_read_kilobytes"), 1s) * count("io_stats_total_read_kilobytes") / count("io_stats_total_read_kilobytes") AS "read", non_negative_derivative(mean("io_stats_total_write_kilobytes"), 1s) AS "write" FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name", "node_host" fill(null)

panels.title: Disk I/O usage

panels.description: The amount of open file descriptors for each OpenSearch node
panels.title: Open File Descriptors

panels.description: Five-minute load average on the system

targets.query: SELECT mean("cpu_load_average_5m") FROM "opensearch_os" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name", "node_host" fill(null)

panels.title: CPU load average (5 min)

panels.description: The usage of CPU in percent for each OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT mean("cpu_percent") FROM "opensearch_process" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name", "node_host" fill(null)

panels.title: CPU load in percent

panels.description: The usage of CPU by each OpenSearch node and its limit

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "cpu/usage_rate" WHERE ("pod_name" =~ /^$node_name$*/ AND "type" = 'pod' AND "namespace_name" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod_name" fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") FROM "cpu/limit" WHERE ("pod_name" =~ /^$node_name$*/ AND "type" = 'pod' AND "namespace_name" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod_name" fill(null)

panels.title: CPU load by pod

panels.description: The number of operations performed by indices at the moment grouped by operation type and OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT  mean(flush_total) as "flush", mean(get_exists_total) as "get-exists", mean(get_missing_total) as "get-missing", mean(get_total) as "get", mean(indexing_delete_total) as "indexing-delete", mean(indexing_index_total) as "indexing-index", mean(indexing_noop_update_total) as "indexing-noop-update", mean(merges_total) as "merges", mean(percolate_total) as "percolate", mean(refresh_total) as "refresh", mean(search_fetch_total) as "search-fetch", mean(search_query_total) as "search-query", mean(search_scroll_total) as "search-scroll", mean(suggest_total) as "suggest", mean(warmer_total) as "warmer" FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE (node_name =~ /$node_name/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), * fill(null)

panels.title: Indices total operations

panels.description: The operations number performed by indices per second grouped by operation type and OpenSearch node
panels.title: Indices operations rate

panels.description: The average time to complete an operation in indices grouped by operation type and OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT mean(merges_total_time_in_millis) AS "merges-total", mean(flush_total_time_in_millis) AS "flush-total", mean(get_exists_time_in_millis) AS "get-exists", mean(get_missing_time_in_millis) AS "get-missing", mean(get_time_in_millis) AS "get", mean(indexing_delete_time_in_millis) AS "indexing-delete", mean(indexing_index_time_in_millis) AS "indexing-index", mean(indexing_throttle_time_in_millis) AS "indexing-throttle", mean(merges_total_stopped_time_in_millis) AS "merges-total-stopped", mean(merges_total_throttled_time_in_millis) AS "merges-total-throttled", mean(merges_total_time_in_millis) AS "merges-total", mean(percolate_time_in_millis) AS "percolate", mean(recovery_throttle_time_in_millis) AS "recovery-throttle", mean(refresh_total_time_in_millis) AS "refresh-total", mean(search_fetch_time_in_millis) AS "search-fetch", mean(search_query_time_in_millis) AS "search-query", mean(search_scroll_time_in_millis) AS "search-scroll", mean(store_throttle_time_in_millis) AS "store-throttle", mean(suggest_time_in_millis) AS "suggest", mean(warmer_total_time_in_millis) AS "warmer-total" FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE (node_name =~ /$node_name/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), * fill(null)

panels.title: Indices time operations

panels.description: The average time to complete an operation in indices per second grouped by operation type and OpenSearch node
panels.title: Indices time operations rate

panels.description: The number of operations performed by indices in the moment grouped by operation type and OpenSearch node

targets.query: SELECT mean("get_current") AS "get", mean("indexing_index_current") AS "index", mean("search_fetch_current") AS "search fetch", mean("search_query_current") AS "search query" FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Indices current operations

panels.description: The size of data stored in indices grouped by OpenSearch nodes

targets.query: SELECT mean("store_size_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_clusterstats_indices" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Indices data size

panels.description: The number of documents stored in indices grouped by OpenSearch nodes

targets.query: SELECT mean("docs_count") FROM "opensearch_clusterstats_indices" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "cluster_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Indices documents count

panels.description: The number of documents added to indices per second grouped by OpenSearch nodes
panels.title: Indices documents rate

panels.description:
If you notice the indexing latency increasing, you may be trying to index too many documents at one time (OpenSearch’s documentation recommends starting with a bulk indexing size of 5 to 15 megabytes and increasing slowly from there).
If you are planning to index a lot of documents and you don’t need the new information to be immediately available for search, you can optimize for indexing performance over search performance by decreasing refresh frequency until you are done indexing.
Flush latency:  If you see this metric increasing steadily, it could indicate a problem with slow disks

targets.query: SELECT mean("indexing_index_time_in_millis") / mean("indexing_index_total") FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "node_name", time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("flush_total_time_in_millis") / mean("flush_total") FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "node_name", time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("get_exists_time_in_millis") / mean("get_exists_total") FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "node_name", time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("search_query_time_in_millis") / mean("search_query_total") FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "node_name", time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("search_fetch_time_in_millis") / mean("search_fetch_total") FROM "opensearch_indices" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "node_name", time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Requests latency

panels.description: The size of each thread pool’s queue represents how many requests are waiting to be served while the node is currently at capacity. The queue allows the node to track and eventually serve these requests instead of discarding them. Thread pool rejections arise once the thread pool’s maximum queue size (which varies based on the type of thread pool) is reached.

targets.query: SELECT max("bulk_rejected") AS "bulk", max("get_rejected") AS "get", max("index_rejected") AS "index", max("search_rejected") AS "search" FROM "opensearch_thread_pool" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Rejected requests

panels.description: The size of each thread pool’s queue represents how many requests are waiting to be served while the node is currently at capacity.

targets.query: SELECT max("bulk_queue") AS "bulk", max("flush_queue") AS "flush", max("get_queue") AS "get", max("index_queue") AS "index", max("refresh_queue") AS "refresh", max("search_queue") AS "search" FROM "opensearch_thread_pool" WHERE ("node_name" =~ /^$node_name$/ AND "namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node_name" fill(null)

panels.title: Thread pool queues
Thread pool queues and requests metrics

panels.description:
Shows the current activity status of the backup daemon. The activity status can be one of following:
* Not Active - There is no running backup process.
* In Progress/Started - The backup process is running.

targets.query: SELECT last("current_status") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("project_name" =~ /^$project$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Daemon Status

panels.description:
Shows the state of the last backup. The backup status can be one of following:
 
* SUCCESS - There is at least one successful backup, and the latest backup is successful.
* FAILED - There are no successful backups, or the last backup failed.

targets.query: SELECT last("last_backup_status") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Last Backup Status

panels.description: Shows the period of time when the last backup process was ended.

targets.query: SELECT last("last_snapshot_time") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time of Last Backup

panels.description:
Shows the current activity status of the backup daemon. The activity status can be one of following:
* Not Active - There is no running backup process.
* In Progress/Started - The backup process is running.

targets.query: SELECT last("current_status") FROM "elasticsearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Daemon Status Transitions

panels.description: Shows the backup storage type.

targets.query: SELECT last("storage_type") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Storage Type

panels.description: Shows the amount of successful backups.

targets.query: SELECT last("count_of_successful_snapshots") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Successful Backup Versions Count

panels.description: Shows the period of time when the last successful backup process was ended.

targets.query: SELECT last("last_snapshot_time") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time of Last Successful Backup

panels.description: Shows the amount of available backups.

targets.query: SELECT last("count_of_snapshots") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Versions Count

panels.description:
Shows the space occupied by backups and the remaining amount of space. 
Not all storage supports total size, so "Total Volume Space" metrics can be zeroed.

targets.query: SELECT (mean("total_total_in_bytes") - mean("total_free_in_bytes")) FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("total_total_in_bytes") FROM "opensearch_fs" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Storage Size/Free Space

panels.description: Shows the changes of activity status on the chart.

targets.query: SELECT mean("last_backup_time_spent") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Activity Status

panels.description: Shows time spent on last backup.

targets.query: SELECT mean("last_backup_time_spent") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time Spent on Backup

panels.description: Shows the size of the last backup.

targets.query: SELECT last("last_backup_size") FROM "opensearch_backups_metric" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Last Version Size

panels.description: The status of DBaaS Adapter.

targets.query: SELECT last("status") FROM "opensearch_dbaas_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: DBaaS Adapter Status

panels.description: The status of OpenSearch cluster from the DBaaS Adapter side

targets.query: SELECT last("elastic_cluster_status")  / 5 FROM "opensearch_dbaas_health" WHERE ("namespace" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "cluster"="$cluster") AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: DBaaS OpenSearch Cluster Status

panels.description: Transitions of DBaaS Adapter statuses
panels.title: DBaaS Adapter Status Transitions

panels.description: Transitions of DBaaS OpenSearch cluster status
panels.title: DBaaS OpenSearch Cluster Status Transitions
